description.narrative: Theproject has four main components: capacity development to the civil society actors (CSAs), issued based capacity building and collective actions for advocay, social enterprises establishment and organzational development.   Problem analysis: The project identified 4 main problems.  Limited capacity of civil society actors, environmental degradation/climate change, alternative education and local economy decrease. Goal: CSAs are more active and capable of implementing sustainable development actions and effectively leading and collaboration with different stakeholders toward eco- friendly life style. Objectives: * To strengthen institutional capacity of CSAs towards inclusive and effective planning and implementation of sustainable development *To support CSAs to be able to lead public engagement and advocacy that contributes to climate change adaptation *To support small-scale producers both (women and men) and CBOs to strengthen local economy through alternative and innovative of agricultural production *To improve GSMI institution capacity in the areas of strategy, governance, and operational performance toward more effective support to CSAs Project activities: Grass-root leadership trainings, TOT, meetings, mentoring, coaching and linking, exposure, consumer education, TOT on consumer education, public campaigns fund support and exhibitions, agriculture skill trainings, networking, publication, documentary film and newsletters.  Regarding climate change adaptation, bike campaign, mud house training, bamboo charcoal making, solar installing will be organized.  Outcomes: *CSAs have capacity to undertake inclusive and effective planning and implementation. *Targeted CSAs have capacity to lead public awareness raising and advocacy on selected thematic issues. *5 social enterprise established and well function. *GSMI staff has adequate capacity to support partner organization Main thematic areas are social and economic justice and environment.
This project mainly contributes to results within Sustainable development and climate justice. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
